Speaker: matthew
Dialogue: Loses his grip on the unicorn.  Archer reaches over and pulls him into his lap.  They happily ride together...  As the horses sweep back INTO VIEW... exposing Archer...  Now we see the sniper.  CASTOR TROY is cool, efficient, aggressive, sexual.  His finger closes around the trigger.  BOOM!  A BULLET RIPS into Archer's back.  Bleeding... he drops off his horse... and sinks to the deck of the carousel.  His eyes desperately searching... searching... searching... until he sees --  Matthew lies on his back -- still.  Slowly, Archer reaches out and takes Matthew's hand... and now we see COLOR for the first time...  Blood red... as bleeding father touches bleeding son...  TILT UP TO the winged Pegasus flying by -- now in full color and UP UP UP TO Matthew's red balloon... floating away.  HANDEL'S MESSIAH OVER a SERIES OF SHOTS:

Speaker: carousel horse
Dialogue: sweeps by, as if marking time itself...

Speaker: holy place
Dialogue: Smoky, spiritual... dominated by a gleaming, golden cross.  A priest kneels before it -- deep in prayer.  The glimmering cross comes INTO FOCUS... but it's just a light-reflection... off the casing of a large bomb.  This is no chapel... but an atrium.  Somewhere.  And as the "priest" rubs out his cigarette we see it's Castor Troy -- carefully installing this complex device.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: pockets his FBI badge, then holsters his gun...

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: sets the bomb timer -- then replaces a wall panel in front of it.  Totally hidden.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Any follow-up from L.A.P.D. Intelligence?

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: No, sir, nothing yet.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Get them on the phone -- now. What about S.I.S. and our airport teams?

Speaker: wanda
Dialogue: We've had everything from psychics to satellites on this.  Even if Castor was here... he must have slipped the net by now...

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: He's here!  And we're going to keep looking until we find him!

Speaker: tito
Dialogue: Jon, these people have been working round the clock -- you gotta cut them some slack...

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: I'll cut them some slack when I cut myself some slack.

Speaker: janitor
Dialogue: What are you doing?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Thank goodness, I feel like Icarus in the labyrinth -- where's the men's room?

Speaker: janitor
Dialogue: How did you get in that room?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Okay... I have a confession to make, but you aren't gonna like it.  I was planting a bomb.

Speaker: janitor
Dialogue: Bomb?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: You know -- boom --  Oh, never mind...

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: I've never enjoyed 'The Messiah.' But your voice makes even a hack like Handel seem like a genius.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: ... I don't have time to get a warrant from some hung-over judge. Just give me the go-ahead, Victor, and I promise -- as soon as this is over -- you can brand my butt with the Fourth Amendment.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Tell her to hang on --

Speaker: tito
Dialogue: A jet was chartered at Anderson Airfield.  Guess who just showed up to pay for it?  Pollux Troy.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Scramble the Reaction Team -- we're moving out.  And get one of our people on that plane.

Speaker: tito
Dialogue: But there's still no sign of Castor...

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Where one brother goes, the other's sure to follow...

Speaker: pollux
Dialogue: You're 26 minutes late.  The casing didn't fit -- right?  I knew that cheap-shit Dietrich would rip us off...

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Oh, God -- !

Speaker: pollux
Dialogue: What!?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: I forgot to turn the damn thing on!

Speaker: pollux
Dialogue: You're kidding, right?  ... are you fucking kidding!?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Bro -- everything went fine.

Speaker: pollux
Dialogue: I hate when you call me bro.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Thanks for babysitting.

Speaker: lunt
Dialogue: Anything else?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: I'll contact you when we get the rest of the money.  Oh, and stat away from downtown. The inversion layer's going to be pretty thick around the 18th.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Let's go, let's go!

Speaker: flight attendant
Dialogue: Would you like anything else?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Hell, yes...  It's the only way to fly.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: What's wrong?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: It's Archer.  Go, dammit!

Speaker: winters
Dialogue: F.B.I.!  Throttle down, captain!

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Get out.

Speaker: tito
Dialogue: You're not playing chicken with two tons of aluminum...

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Get out!

Speaker: collision course
Dialogue: as two hunks of metal bear down.  The machines are seconds apart when --  Archer looks up to see...  Winters' face pressed up against the cockpit window, Castor holding a gun to her head.  Archer cuts the wheel -- just avoiding the jet.  The Hummer skids to a stop as Federal back-up arrives -- but too late.  Archer watches an FBI chopper -- landing in a swirl of dust.  As the jet picks up speed... the hatch opens.  Castor blasts Winters in the side and tosses her onto the tarmac.

Speaker: inside
Dialogue: Castor smiles at Pollux, sensing freedom, until...  KA-CHUNK:  Something POUNDS the jet -- from above. Castor leans out the hatch and sees...  The chopper on top of them -- Archer at the controls.  Eye-contact -- years of hatred pass between these men.  Castor BLASTS at him from the open hatch.  The chopper's left windscreen spiderwebs.  Archer jerks and weaves -- dodging the BULLETS.  The chopper pulls away.  The jet finally lifts off... when...  The chopper settles on the jet -- slamming at its tail.

Speaker: tarmac
Dialogue: Tito reacts to this madness -- as the chopper plays a deadly game of leap-frog with the jet.  The end of the runway is coming up fast.  Archer crushes the jet's horizontal elevator flap.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: What are you doing?

Speaker: pilot
Dialogue: The horizontal elevator's smashed! We can't lift off!

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: SHOOTS the Pilot -- then takes the controls.  He struggles to maneuver the jet.  Suddenly...  A biplane descends right at them -- about to land.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: pulls up just as the JET swerves radically to avoid the biplane and SLAMS into the hangar.

Speaker: jet
Dialogue: plows through the GLASS DOOR, the NOSE-WHEEL SNAPS off. The PLANE SKIDS right into the hangar -- finally stopping at the wings.

Speaker: fbi chopper
Dialogue: lands.  Archer steps out calmly -- like a cop about to write a traffic ticket.  He hurries to join more FBI agents rushing into the hangar ahead of him.

Speaker: pollux
Dialogue: Forget it -- Go!  Go!

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Wherever they put you, I'll find a way to get you out...

Speaker: tito
Dialogue: -- not unless you want that 200 I.Q. splattered all over the floor.  We got him now, Jon.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: That's what you always say.  Seal it off.  I'm going in.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Jon, I'm getting a little annoyed by your obsessive need to spoil my fun.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: And how much will your 'fun' net you this time?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: What's it to you?  I declare it. Here I am, back in the States for less than a week --

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: You're under arrest.  Incredibly, you still have the right to remain silent --

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: I've got something going down on the eighteenth... it's gonna be worse than anything God ever dumped on the Pharaoh.  I'll give it up -- but my brother and I have to walk.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: No discussion -- no deals.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: What're you gonna do with me locked up?  You'll drive your wife and kid nuts!  I bet your daughter is just about ripe by now.  What's her name, Janie?

Speaker: tito
Dialogue: Tell me he didn't get away again...

Speaker: pollux
Dialogue: Where's my brother?!  I want to see my brother!

Speaker: lazarro
Dialogue: The oversight committee would've roasted us for this one -- thank God it paid off.  Damn fine work.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Real fine, Victor.  Especially the casualties.

Speaker: lazarro
Dialogue: Classified information.  No photographs.

Speaker: lazarro
Dialogue: You okay, Jon?  Then go home.  Tell Eve.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Hi...  ... What's wrong?

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: She complimented for her 'F' in history with an 'A' in shoplifting...

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Nice stunt, Jamie.  You break the law and I'm expected to ignore it?

Speaker: jamie
Dialogue: That's right -- it's all about you.  Don't even ask me what happened.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Okay.  What happened?

Speaker: jamie
Dialogue: Like you'd ever fucking believe me!

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Well, you tried.  You failed miserably, but you tried.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Why won't she even talk to me?

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Maybe because you taught her never to speak to strangers.  I'm sorry... that wasn't fair.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: I've got patients waiting.  Try again, Jon.  She hates you -- but she needs you.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Eve...

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Jon -- what is it?

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Is it -- him?  It's... it's over?

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: I'm going to make everything up to you and Jamie.  I'll put in for a desk job.  We'll go away, get counseling -- anything you want. This time, I mean it.

Speaker: security guard
Dialogue: Print, please.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Much appreciated.  Now let's get back to work, okay?

Speaker: wanda
Dialogue: Is that stick ever gonna fall out of his ass?

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: The C.I.A. sent this over.  What should I do with it?

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Send it back and tell them to stop wasting the taxpayers' money. Anything else, Miss Brewster?

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: No, sir.

Speaker: kimberly
Dialogue: Four years -- and he still calls me 'Miss Brewster.'

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: How's Loomis?

Speaker: tito
Dialogue: He needs some surgery, but he's going to be okay.  That's the good news...

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Go on.

Speaker: tito
Dialogue: ... Brodie and Miller from Special Ops need to see you.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: I don't have time for those cloak and dagger guys.

Speaker: brodie
Dialogue: You better make time, Jon.  We found this in the jet wreckage -- among Pollux Troy's effects...

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Porcelain casing... Thermal cloak... Undetectable payload.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Powerful enough to flatten ten city blocks.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: 'Worse than anything God ever dumped on the Pharaohs.'  Get Pollux Troy.  Now.

Speaker: interrogation footage
Dialogue: Wired to a complex machine -- Pollux seems to have his frustrated interrogators on the run.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: He's lying.

Speaker: lazarro
Dialogue: He's hooked up to a full-spectrum polygraph.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Pollux is a manipulative psychopath.  He can control his heartbeat, his sweat glands, his blood pressure...

Speaker: lazarro
Dialogue: Jon, I trust your instincts, I always have.  But D.C. wants more evidence.  And frankly, so do I.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: You'll get all the evidence you need when ten thousand people die.

Speaker: lazarro
Dialogue: We'll get a team right on it.  But we can't evacuate the city on what amounts to a hunch.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: That bomb has been built, it's out there somewhere and it's going to detonate...

Speaker: brodie
Dialogue: Didn't Castor give any clue where the bomb might be?

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Only one person knows -- his brother Pollux.  And he'll keep his mouth shut until it blows.

Speaker: brodie
Dialogue: We could plant an agent in his cell -- get him to spill the location.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Pollux is way too paranoid.  The only person he'd talk to about that bomb is Castor himself.  And dead men can't talk.

Speaker: brodie
Dialogue: There might be a way around that...

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Why are you keeping him alive?  As long as he's breathing, he's dangerous.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: Relax, he's a turnip.

Speaker: brodie
Dialogue: We can arrange for you to enter Erewhon Prison -- as Castor Troy.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: What are you talking about?

Speaker: hoag
Dialogue: I think I'd better answer that question.  Malcolm Hoag.  I run the Physiological Camouflage Unit for Special Ops.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: I know who you are.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: But you don't know what he can do. Physical augmentation; enhancement surgery...

Speaker: brodie
Dialogue: ... He can disguise a compromised agent or alter the likeness -- even the voice -- of a government witness.

Speaker: hoag
Dialogue: Let me show you how it's done.  I think you'll recognize our patient...

Speaker: hoag
Dialogue: With our new generation of anti- inflammatories, healing is accelerated from weeks to days. By his next paycheck, he won't even remember which ear he lost.  Your situation, however, would be a little less permanent...

Speaker: brodie
Dialogue: -- and a lot more classified.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: This'll fool Pollux.

Speaker: hoag
Dialogue: That is a state-of-the-art morpho- genetic template.  The inside can be built to match the exact shape of your skull; the outside -- exactly like Castor's.  Then we fit his face right on top --

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: -- and you become him.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: You're talking about removing the guy's face?

Speaker: brodie
Dialogue: Borrowing, Jon.  The procedure's completely reversible.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: One way or the other -- the mission ends on the eighteenth.

Speaker: brodie
Dialogue: You know Castor better than anyone.  You've lived and breathed him for years -- hell, you even look a little like him.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Find yourself another lab-rat.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: If you don't do this -- Castor will beat us again.  He'll beat you again...

Speaker: hoag
Dialogue: I don't think that went very well.

Speaker: brodie
Dialogue: Trust us, Doc...

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: ... he'll jerk around.  Then he'll be back.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: I'm in a hurry, Dietrich.  So you've only got ten seconds to go through your usual litany of lies, empty threats, and moronic denials.  Then I'm coming over there --

Speaker: dietrich
Dialogue: If you're in such a fucking hurry -- why are you wasting your time with me?  I'm just an art dealer.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: You're a dealer, all right: technical secrets, munitions... explosives.

Speaker: dietrich
Dialogue: You've never proven any of that. And when my bitchy, never-been- laid femi-nazi lawyer gets here, she's going to...

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Time's up.

Speaker: lazarro
Dialogue: The only ticking bomb I see is inside his head.  He's getting worse, Tito.

Speaker: tito
Dialogue: Don't worry, sir.  It's all an act...

Speaker: dietrich
Dialogue: ... Okay!  Castor called me but I blew him off... I swear I never saw him.  And I don't know anything about any bomb!

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Let him go, but I want him watched... Who's next?

Speaker: tito
Dialogue: Just Dietrich's sister...

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: When was the last time you saw Castor Troy?

Speaker: sasha
Dialogue: Who cares?  He's dead.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Answer the question.

Speaker: sasha
Dialogue: Look, I'm clean.  I teach kids now --

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Sasha -- you are a felon, on probation for harboring Castor Troy.  So it's in your best interest to cooperate.  Would you like your son put in a foster home?

Speaker: sasha
Dialogue: No, but I'm sure you'd love it -- you sick bastard.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: When was the last time you saw Castor Troy?

Speaker: sasha
Dialogue: I haven't seen him for years.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: What about Lazarro?

Speaker: brodie
Dialogue: No way -- the red tape alone would take a month.  This is a black-bag operation -- completely off the books.

Speaker: miller
Dialogue: If you need him, Tito can help you prepare.  But you know the drill: You can't tell anyone -- not the Director, not your wife... nobody.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: I'm in.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: I was dreaming...

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Something good?

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: I'm not sure... you were flying this weird old stunt plane... doing flips... walking on the wings... I was watching from the ground -- when you fell.  You had a parachute, but you wouldn't open it.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Did you catch me?

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: How come?

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: I don't know...  Maybe because you've never needed my help.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Come on, you made that up, didn't you?

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: ... Maybe I did...  ... maybe I didn't...

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: It's all right, Jon.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: After all these years, I still can't get it out of my head -- an inch to the left, Matty would still be alive.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: And you wouldn't be.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Things will get better now that you're home.  Everything will be better -- now that... that man is finally out of our lives.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Eve...

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: ... If I had to do something to find some closure... I should do it, shouldn't I?... No matter how crazy?

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Oh, God -- you're going on assignment again...

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: One last time.  And while I'm gone, I want you and Jamie to go to your mother's.  It's important...

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: You said you'd be here!  You promised!  What could be more important than that?

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: I can't tell you... except only I can do it.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: You want me to tell you it's okay to leave?  Okay, go on!  Go!

Speaker: tito
Dialogue: Jon, this is goddam insane.  You can't do it.

Speaker: tito
Dialogue: You haven't got a chance in hell of fooling Pollux.  Castor drinks, smokes and walks around with a 24- hour hard-on.  He's nothing like you --

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Don't worry... If Hoag can do half what he claims, I'll get Pollux to talk.

Speaker: tito
Dialogue: It's not that simple, Jon... Becoming another person -- especially him -- nobody can come all the way back from that... not even you.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Keep this for me.

Speaker: hoag
Dialogue: Let's walk through it, Jon.  Your blood types are different, but we can't do anything about that. Otherwise, nature is cooperating nicely.  The height difference is negligible -- within 1/2 an inch. Eye color -- almost a perfect match.  Penis size, flaccid, essentially the same -- Substantial.

Speaker: hoag
Dialogue: Hairline will be adjusted with laser-shears... micro-plugs for the body hair... the teeth will be bonded to match Castor's...

Speaker: hoag
Dialogue: How about an abdominoplasty?

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Abdomino -- what?

Speaker: hoag
Dialogue: A tummy tuck.  On the house.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Do it.

Speaker: transformation montage
Dialogue: :  Globules of adipose tissue are siphoned off Archer's obliques.  At the same time...  Hoag recreates the "Great Sphinx" tattoo on Archer's thigh.  We PUSH IN ON his leg, then PULL BACK to reveal...  Archer and Tito.  The CLOSE UP on his leg becomes a FULL SHOT as he walks across the rooftop -- like himself. Tito demonstrated the proper "Castor gait": dangerously casual, like a panther.  Hoag reproduces Castor's fingerprints... then layers them over Archer's fingers.  Archer practices Castor's icy, killer glare.  Tito hands him a lit cigarette.  Archer brings the cigarette to his lips -- then coughs harshly.  But he keeps trying.  Castor smiles... then smirks and laughs.  PULL BACK to reveal Archer studying surveillance footage of Castor on a monitor-screen -- mimicking him.  Archer fusses with his new hair, trying to cover the thin spots.  Giving  up, he zips up his sweatshirt -- getting the zipper caught in his new chest hair.

Speaker: tito
Dialogue: Nice catch.  But you used the wrong hand.

Speaker: tito
Dialogue: Shoot me.  Shoot me!

Speaker: tito
Dialogue: You want to be Castor Troy?  If you hesitate for a breath, you're finished!  Now -- shoot me!  Kill me!

Speaker: tito
Dialogue: You can't do it... because Castor is tougher than you...

Speaker: hoag
Dialogue: Let's see if I missed anything before I get my hands really dirty.

Speaker: hoag
Dialogue: You realize this has to be removed.  Then here we go, Commander. Through the Looking Glass...

Speaker: hoag
Dialogue: Make sure you get everything -- I'll need to study the tape before the reverse surgery.

Speaker: hoag
Dialogue: Vault it.

Speaker: tito
Dialogue: Jon -- are you all right?

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Okay... I'm okay.  But my voice... I still sound like me.

Speaker: hoag
Dialogue: I implanted a micro-chip onto your larynx.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Now what?

Speaker: tito
Dialogue: We're down to 72 hours.  Let's call Lazarro.  Castor Troy just came out of his coma.

Speaker: tito
Dialogue: Watch this hard-case -- he'll bite your nuts off if he gets the chance!

Speaker: loomis
Dialogue: What a week for Archer to go on a training op.  Maybe we should try to contact him.

Speaker: wanda
Dialogue: Forget it.  He's knee-deep in Georgia swamp by now.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Don't forget -- I ordered a kosher meal...

Speaker: walton
Dialogue: You are now an Erewhon inmate -- a citizen of nowhere.  Human rights zealots, the Geneva convention and the P.C. police have no authority here.  You have no right...  When I say your ass belongs to me -- I mean it.  Bend over.

Speaker: walton
Dialogue: Step into them.

Speaker: walton
Dialogue: Don't sniff 'em, you perv.  Just step into them.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: They're too tight.

Speaker: walton
Dialogue: So's a noose.  Now keep your mouth shut.

Speaker: walton
Dialogue: The prison's one big magnetic field.  The boots'll tell us where you are -- every second of the day.  201 to Population.

Speaker: walton
Dialogue: I've got fifty bucks says you're dead by dinner.  Don't disappoint me.

Speaker: little man
Dialogue: Hey, Castor -- remember me?

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Fabrice Voisine... sure, I --  -- I believe Jon Archer busted you for poisoning five members of the the Canadian parliament?

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Do I look wasted -- asshole?

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Central.  I have a disturbance in population.  Go to lock down --

Speaker: walton
Dialogue: Hold that lock down.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Never -- in -- the -- face.

Speaker: walton
Dialogue: Lock 'em down.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: What?  He started it!

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: When I get out of here --

Speaker: walton
Dialogue: You'll what?

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: I'm going to have you fired.

Speaker: walton
Dialogue: Back to your 'suites' -- or no dinner.

Speaker: pollux
Dialogue: Hey, bro...

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: -- Pollux?

Speaker: pollux
Dialogue: Of course it's Pollux, what the fuck's wrong with you?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Lars... okay, Lunt, then.  Something really fucked-up happened... I'm in trouble... so listen very carefully...

Speaker: hoag
Dialogue: What's this about?  What do you want?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: What do you think I want?

Speaker: pollux
Dialogue: You realize, of course, that magnetic humming is designed to drive us insane.  If we all don't get brain tumors first.

Speaker: voisine
Dialogue: And that same cloying Bambi tape -- over and over...

Speaker: pollux
Dialogue: It's like they're begging us to riot.  Where the fuck are we, anyway?  Gotta go...

Speaker: pollux
Dialogue: ... I'm worried about you.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: pollux
Dialogue: Your jumpshot has no arc.  You used to swagger... now you swish. You're gumming that butt like a Catholic school girl.  And why do you keep picking at your finger?

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: I was in a coma...

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: My reflexes, my senses, my memory... everything's jumbled.  I can't even tell you why Dubov jumped me yesterday.

Speaker: pollux
Dialogue: You Pollinated his wife the day he was arrested.  How could forget that?

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: I've forgotten plenty.  Look around -- we've screwed over half the freaks in here.  What's gonna happen to us if they think I've lost it?

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: I need you to play big brother for once -- till I can fill in a few blanks.  Think you can handle that?

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: I know I got this on my tenth birthday.  I just can't remember why.

Speaker: pollux
Dialogue: Man -- that was the worst day of our lives!

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Oh, God -- Mom O-D'd at County General.

Speaker: pollux
Dialogue: Retching and convulsing while those bastards didn't even try to save her sorry ass.  You gave her mouth to mouth -- man -- even then you had some constitution.  Remember what you swore to me at the funeral?

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Uh -- to kill the doctors?

Speaker: pollux
Dialogue: After that.  You promised you'd always take care of me.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: And I bet I kept that promise...

Speaker: pollux
Dialogue: Only one you've never broken.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Screw the past.  We've got the future to look forward to.  We still have tomorrow.

Speaker: pollux
Dialogue: No shit... five million bucks... now those Red Militia crackpots get to keep it.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: That's not the worst part.

Speaker: pollux
Dialogue: What's worse than losing five million bucks?

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Being stuck in this rat-hole when it blows.  What you built was a work of art.  It belongs in the Smithsonian.

Speaker: pollux
Dialogue: Yeah -- well... the L.A. Convention Center will have to do...

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Thanks, Pollux.

Speaker: pollux
Dialogue: 'Thanks'?  I guess they really did fuck you up.

Speaker: walton
Dialogue: You have a visitor.

Speaker: impostor
Dialogue: What's the matter?  Don't you like the new me?

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: -- Castor...?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Not anymore.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: It can't be.  It's impossible.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: I believe the phrase Dr. Hoag used was 'titanically remote'.  Who knows?  Maybe the trauma of having my face cut off pulled me out.  Or maybe God really is on my side after all.  By the way, I know you don't get the papers in here.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Terrible tragedy. Hoag was such a genius -- but selfish with his artistry.  I actually had to torture his assistants to convince him to perform the same surgery on me.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: You killed them?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Of course I killed them, you dumb fuck.  Hoag, his staff...

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Miller and Brodie --

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: I even paid a visit to your buddy Tito.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: He doesn't know anything about this!

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Come on, Jon.  I think I know you better than that.  I only wish you could have been there to see the look on his face --

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: -- then again, I guess you were there.  I torched every shred of evidence that proves who you are.  So swallow this -- you are going to be in here for the rest of your life.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Castor, don't do this --

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: No discussion, Jon -- no deals. Now if you'll excuse me, I've got an important government job to abuse, and a beautiful wife to fuck.  Excuse me -- I mean 'make love to.'

Speaker: walton
Dialogue: Sorry, sir.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: It's quite all right.  You never know what to expect from a psychopathic criminal...

Speaker: walton
Dialogue: Better be nice, Castor.  You could get mighty lonely now that Pollux is gone.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Pollux is -- what?

Speaker: walton
Dialogue: Archer cut him a deal for turning state's evidence.  He's been released...

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Walton, you have to listen to me -- right now!

Speaker: walton
Dialogue: Or what?  You'll have me fired?  You're confined until I say otherwise...

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Jesus, what a life.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: I suppose it was only a matter of time before you forgot where we lived.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Sorry -- the job's been murder lately.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: So what happened to your 'important' assignment?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: What do you know about it?

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: I know exactly what you always tell me:  Absolutely nothing.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: It didn't work out the way everyone thought it would.  Where are you off to?

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: I've got surgery.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Surgery -- are you okay?

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Don't try to charm me -- I'm still angry.  There're leftovers in the fridge.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Have fun at work.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: What is with you?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Don't I usually kiss my wife?

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: What a dump.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: '... "Date-night" has been a typical failure... we haven't made love in almost two months...' What a loser ...

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: The plot thickens.

Speaker: jamie
Dialogue: -- I got your E-mail, Karl.  That poem was really sweet --  Hang on a sec...

Speaker: jamie
Dialogue: I'll call you back.  You're not respecting my boundaries.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: I'm coming in, Janie.

Speaker: jamie
Dialogue: 'Janie'?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: I don't think you heard me... Jamie... You have something I want ...

Speaker: jamie
Dialogue: Clarissa left those here.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: I won't tell mom if you don't.

Speaker: jamie
Dialogue: When did you start smoking?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: You'll be seeing a lot of changes around here --  Daddy's a new man.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Listen, sir... we just want you to know...

Speaker: wanda
Dialogue: We're all really sorry about Tito...

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Yeah, well, shit happens.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: How's our star witness?

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: He hasn't told us a damn thing except what kind of mustard he likes on his tongue sandwiches.

Speaker: wanda
Dialogue: If that bomb is out there -- we're almost out of time.

Speaker: lazarro
Dialogue: You made a deal with Pollux Troy? He's 'a manipulative psychopath.' Your own words, Jon!

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Just let me do my job, Victor.

Speaker: lazarro
Dialogue: The job I've been protecting for the last eight years.  From now on, you go strictly by the book. Everything gets cleared by me. Understand?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: You're supposed to be snitching -- making me look good.

Speaker: pollux
Dialogue: 'Look good'?  Seeing that face -- I want to vomit.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: I'm the one who has to look at this butt-ugly mug every time I pass a mirror.  Look at my eyes, my chin, my perfect nose -- gone!  Archer took my life, so I'm taking his.  Bro, I'm going straight.

Speaker: pollux
Dialogue: Sounds like they took your brain, too?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Imagine Dillinger as J. Edgar Hoover.  Carlos the Jackal running Interpol.  Kaddafi heading the Mossad.  Think of the secrets we could sell...

Speaker: pollux
Dialogue: The drug agents we could expose. The movie stars we could blackmail!

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: That's just the bottom of the food chain.  Pollux -- what would happen if somebody planted a bomb on Air Force One?

Speaker: pollux
Dialogue: ... that somebody would get rich. And, I suppose, the nation would be pretty pissed-off.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Pissed-off, vulnerable... looking for someone to step in, take charge, give them hope again. What if that someone was an F.B.I. hero?  A true Boy Scout and family man -- with a spotless past. Imagine where that guy could land -- if the timing's right.

Speaker: pollux
Dialogue: It's an audacious dream, Caz.  But Jon Archer is hardly a household name.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Not yet he isn't.  But after you 'confess' -- you'll be a free man. And I'll be on my way...

Speaker: bomb leader
Dialogue: Jesus... Any suggestions?

Speaker: technician
Dialogue: Yeah... run

Speaker: bomb leader
Dialogue: It's protected by a vibration detector... One touch and...

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Evacuate your team, Captain.

Speaker: bomb leader
Dialogue: Sir, you can't disarm it --

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Just go!

Speaker: walton
Dialogue: A special privilege today:  TV -- by order of Agent Jon Archer of the F.B.I...

Speaker: reporter rice
Dialogue: The apparent target was a group of Supreme Court justices -- due to speak here today.  Mr. Archer, do you have any idea who planted it?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: That's classified.  But if he's listening I have a message for him:  Nice try.  Now you know who's really in charge.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Don't you guys watch TV?  Where's the parade?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: -- Loomis, Buzz, uh -- Wanda... all of you, thanks from the bottom of my heart.  Thanks for enduring all those years I was an insufferable boor.  From now on -- consider me reborn.

Speaker: wanda
Dialogue: Stop the presses -- Jon Archer found a personality...

Speaker: kim
Dialogue: Sir... the White House is calling.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Jon, your career is finally taking of.  Archer.  Sure I'll hold...

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Mr. President, what an honor...

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: How about a game of horse?

Speaker: jamie
Dialogue: Don't make me beat your butt again, Dad.  It's harmful to my developing psyche.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Afraid you'll lose?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Try putting a higher arc on the ball... and square your shoulders to the basket.

Speaker: jamie
Dialogue: Gotta go.  Karl's here.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Don't tell me you forgot.  Eve -- it's date night!

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Why do I feel like I'm on a blind date?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: It's important to keep some mystery... so things stay... unpredictable.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: 'Unpredictable'?  You're about as unpredictable as the tide.  How long are you going to be gone this time?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Gone?

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Isn't that what all this is about? The wine, cooking me dinner -- your next assignment?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: I'm not going anywhere.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: You always say that -- then you leave.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: I bet I deserved that.  I bet Jon Archer is the most inattentive, sexless spouse on Earth.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Jon, that's not true --

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Of course it's true, but I'm trying to change?  I'm here because I want to be alone with you.  I want to see the candle- light dance in your beautiful --

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: -- brown eyes.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: I wanted it all to be just right... when I told you about my promotion.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Your what?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Well, I don't have it yet.  But Lazarro's getting old -- he won't be around forever.  And I'm getting the itch to move up.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Jon... that's wonderful.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: So you see, I'm not going anywhere.  Unless it's upstairs with you...

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: baby, it's like I'm having you for the first time.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Don't they ever let us take off these boots?

Speaker: voisine
Dialogue: Not unless you're sent to the 'Clinic.'

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: You mean if I get sick?

Speaker: voisine
Dialogue: They don't give two fucks about your health.  The Clinic's where they send the real hard-cases for attitude adjustment.  Dubov just got sent down -- and look at Wainwright --

Speaker: voisine
Dialogue: Toughest bastard I ever saw -- after you, of course.  Now he's a fucking drool case.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: What did he do?

Speaker: voisine
Dialogue: He hit a guard.

Speaker: walton
Dialogue: Looking for trouble, Castor?

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: As a matter of fact -- yes.

Speaker: walton
Dialogue: Bite hard, scumbag, 'cause you'll be gumming baby food from here on out.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Dubov -- come on!

Speaker: around prison
Dialogue: Chaos.  Guards scatter as the huge diamond-vision SCREEN EXPLODES and inmates are flung like rag-dolls by their short-circuiting boots.  Anything metallic flies into the magnetic domes.

Speaker: security central
Dialogue: As the men back through the cable duct -- Archer struggles to replace the heavy console.  The DOOR is BLOWN open.  Walton enters to find... no one. Then his eyes light on the console -- slightly askew.

Speaker: walton
Dialogue: There!

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Let's go!

Speaker: inside cockpit
Dialogue: Archer searches for the keys.  No go.  He throws switches.  Nothing works.  Guards pour out of the hatch -- FIRING.  Archer leaps from the chopper and jumps over the side to the platform's --

Speaker: lower level
Dialogue: He lands hard on the slanted, corrugated shed roof and rolls to the ground.  He grabs a high-pressure hose -- and cranks the pressure valve -- as the pursuing guards close in.  Archer BLASTS the guards with the WATER CANNON -- knocking Walton and others into the sea.  Archer upends a stack of oil barrels -- which roll into more guards. Archer spots:

Speaker: tugboat
Dialogue: pulling a Zodiac dinghy -- heading out to sea.  Archer jumps up a stack of pipes to the south rail -- where the end of a crane's hook is tagged back.  Under FIRE -- Archer frees the hook, which swings away from the platform.  Hanging on to the hook, it swings him out over the ocean. At the apex -- le lets go and plummets down into...

Speaker: choppy sea
Dialogue: He pulls himself into the ZODIAC and frees it from the tug.  It ROARS off.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Come on... come on...

Speaker: wide shot
Dialogue: The chopper settles over the Zodiac.  Wind and water swirl around Archer...

Speaker: chopper
Dialogue: Walton, drenched but obviously rescued, has archer in his sights... He starts to FIRE his MACHINE GUNS...

Speaker: zodiac
Dialogue: BULLETS RAIN down on the boat -- destroying it -- as Archer dives into the rolling swells...

Speaker: inside chopper
Dialogue: Walton RAKES the debris -- shredding it.  The chopper does a final circle of the wreckage... then moves off... its ROTOR WASH THRASHING the buoy.

Speaker: under buoy
Dialogue: Archer has crawled up into the hollow buoy -- sucking air.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Last night, I thought -- this isn't my husband.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Then I woke up in the middle of the night -- and found you passed out in the study.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: I couldn't sleep -- you roll around a lot.  Anyway, I'm late.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Jon, you know what day it is.  I know it's difficult for you, but we still have to go.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Can't we skip it just this once? I gotta 'protect and serve', you know.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: 'Protect and serve' later.  You're going.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Okay, if you insist.  But -- you drive.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: So who's this Karl creep Jamie's been seeing?  He's a little old for her, isn't he?

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: I don't know... they're about the same ages we were when we met.  Remember the all-night dentist?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Sure, how could I forget.  By the way, you never said anything about last night...

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Aren't you going to get that?

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Jon -- this is hardly the time or place.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Happy birthday, Matty.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: He took our baby, Jon.  He took our little boy.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Stop crying... stop crying... stop ...

Speaker: wanda
Dialogue: You picked a helluva day to leave your beeper off!

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: What happened?

Speaker: wanda
Dialogue: Castor's dead!

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: He's -- what?

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: Somehow he escaped from Erewhon. But a prison chopper mowed him down just off Long Beach Harbor...

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Where's the body?

Speaker: wanda
Dialogue: It hasn't been recovered yet.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: 'It hasn't been recovered yet!' You people have no idea who you're dealing with!  I want everyone on this, reports on the half hour, and all leads get routed through my office. Buzz, alert the L.A.P.D.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: L.A.P.D.?  Even if he is alive, Castor isn't stupid enough to come back to the city.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: He's alive -- and he's already here.  Move!

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Dr. Archer please.   It's an emergency.  -- Her husband.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Hello, Eve -- I know this sounds crazy, but --  Dammit.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: How did this happen, sweetie?

Speaker: iris's dad
Dialogue: She fell off her Big-Wheel.

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: Dr. Archer -- your husband's on three.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Get Child Services down here -- and don't let her father leave.  Jon?  Hello?

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Eve, listen carefully.  The man you think is your husband -- isn't.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Who is this?

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Please, just listen!  Take Jamie and go to your mother's in Santa Fe.  Don't tell him where you're going -- just go.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Whoever you are -- don't call again...

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: I need to speak to Director Lazarro immediately... I have information about Castor Troy.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: This is Jon Archer.  Who's calling?

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Well, if you're Jon Archer... I guess this must be Castor Troy...

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: I've gotta hand it to you, Jon. You're doing a damn respectable job of being me.  But let's face it, we both liked it better the way it was.  So before the cops blow your brains out -- why not tell me where you are...

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: If you were really me, you'd know -- no discussion, no deals.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: No, Jon... you have to think like Castor.  Where would he go...?

Speaker: dietrich
Dialogue: Jon Archer... some poor schmuck's in big trouble.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Yeah -- me.

Speaker: dietrich
Dialogue: Jesus Christ, Castor.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Drive.  And punch up your cellular -- I need you to make some calls.

Speaker: dietrich
Dialogue: You're gonna get me busted!

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: You're already busted, Dietrich. It's just a matter of time before they pick you up.

Speaker: dietrich
Dialogue: Man, when you came to me about that bomb -- I knew I should have blown you off... but that's my fucking curse -- I just can't say no to a friend.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: You can't say no to money.

Speaker: dietrich
Dialogue: That's my other curse.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: You're Castor Troy... This is your old crew -- you don't take shit and you don't take no for an answer...

Speaker: aldo
Dialogue: Helluva place, Dietrich.  So what's the big surprise?

Speaker: fitch
Dialogue: Are you crazy?  You're going to bring the Feds down on all of us!

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Archer doesn't want you, he wants me!  But I'm going to get him first -- with your help.

Speaker: aldo
Dialogue: Archer's a damn celebrity now -- he's untouchable -- and you're radioactive.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: You wanna face-off with Castor Troy?  Come on, then!  Come on! 'Cause I've had a real bad day...

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: You're all forgetting who the real enemy is.  Six months ago, Jon Archer hauled you in for questioning.  He rattled you so bad -- you shit your Armani suit right there in the interrogation room.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: You laugh, Fitch -- the way Archer laughed at your last arraignment, when you got down on your knees and tried to blow your way to freedom.

Speaker: dietrich
Dialogue: We all have a reason to hate Jon Archer.  We all want to see him dead --

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: And nobody's untouchable if we say he's not.

Speaker: dietrich
Dialogue: It's all worked out.  Caz has Archer's routine down cold.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: We start with your basic kidnapping.  Then -- a little surgery.

Speaker: fitch
Dialogue: Surgery?

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: I'm going to rearrange his face in a way you won't believe.

Speaker: aldo
Dialogue: You're an evil bitch, Caz.  But you've got balls of titanium. Count us in.

Speaker: dietrich
Dialogue: Come on -- let's drink to it!

Speaker: dietrich
Dialogue: How about one of your famous toasts, Caz?

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: To old jobs, new jobs and -- uh -- blow jobs?

Speaker: livia
Dialogue: Enough business, Caz.  Let's dance.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Sorry... I don't...

Speaker: livia
Dialogue: Remember the Charger's game, Caz? The owners box?  We did it four times.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Sure I remember... Once a quarter, right?

Speaker: livia
Dialogue: Caz?  Are you okay?

Speaker: dietrich
Dialogue: When even Castor Troy can't handle a tab of Quantrex...  That, dear friends, is the first sorry whiff of old age.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: -- Sasha Hassler.  Age 35.  Met Castor Troy in Austin, Texas, at Pearl Jam reunion...  Uh, how you doing, baby?

Speaker: sasha
Dialogue: What the hell are you doing here? You're supposed to be dead...

Speaker: down street
Dialogue: A BMW pulls up to the curb.  The THUMPING MUSIC from within GOES QUIET, but no one emerges.

Speaker: jamie
Dialogue: No... Karl, please.

Speaker: jamie
Dialogue: My father -- he's got a gun -- he'll -- he'll --

Speaker: karl
Dialogue: That wimp won't do shit.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Who are you to call Jon Archer a wimp?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: What are you -- stupid?

Speaker: jamie
Dialogue: That's just like you.  Some guy tries to rape me -- and you side with him.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Did it look like I was siding with him?  Did it?  You want to play with scummy organ grinders, you better be prepared. Do you have protection?

Speaker: jamie
Dialogue: You mean like... condoms?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: I mean like... protection.

Speaker: jamie
Dialogue: For me?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Next time -- slip it in low, then twist it -- so the wound doesn't close.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Go on, get out of here.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: No wonder he spent all his time chasing me.  Who can deal with this family shit?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Jon Archer.  Where is he?

Speaker: pollux
Dialogue: -- I thought he might visit some old friends of yours.  And bro, if I didn't know better -- I'd swear this guy likes being you...

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Uh -- can't we just talk?

Speaker: sasha
Dialogue: Talk?  The only talk I ever heard from you was 'take it off,' 'sit on it,' 'I'll pay you tomorrow.'

Speaker: sasha
Dialogue: Take off the rest of those rags and get dressed.  Then get out.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Not until I finish my business with your brother.

Speaker: sasha
Dialogue: I told him to keep those creeps away -- but you're just too big an attraction.  Look, if the F.B.I. finds out you've been here -- I'll lose my son.  So please, just go.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: I know I've done some things that made your life harder...

Speaker: sasha
Dialogue: How would you?  You walked out and never looked back.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: I'm not the same person you remember.  And for what it's worth, I'm sorry...

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Not a bad fit.

Speaker: sasha
Dialogue: They should.  They're yours.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Nice-looking kid, too

Speaker: sasha
Dialogue: Of course he is...

Speaker: sasha
Dialogue: Adam, come here... I want you to meet your father.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: We've got him sighted.  Okay, Pollux, pull out.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: What makes you so sure this guy's gonna set up his own brother?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: I've never been more certain of anything.  Get everyone in position.  Remember -- shoot to kill.

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: You heard the man -- let's saddle up!

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: How old is he?

Speaker: sasha
Dialogue: Five.  No one knows you're his father.  I thought someone might want to hurt him -- just to hurt you...

Speaker: adam
Dialogue: Bang!  Bang!  Bang!

Speaker: sasha
Dialogue: You know Mommy doesn't like you playing with these things...

Speaker: sasha
Dialogue: You're not holding him right... Caz...

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: He's not my son.

Speaker: sasha
Dialogue: Yes, he is -- !

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Get down!

Speaker: outside
Dialogue: across the way, Castor directs the FIREPOWER.

Speaker: kitchen
Dialogue: Cindee and Fitch are caught in flagrante delicto on the floor as the kitchen is decimated by GUNFIRE...

Speaker: sasha
Dialogue: Adam!

Speaker: lower level
Dialogue: Archer hustles Sasha and Adam toward the staircase when --

Speaker: front door
Dialogue: explodes open.  SWAT agents swarm to get in -- FIRING and throwing FLASH-GRENADES.

Speaker: upper level
Dialogue: Dietrich, et al, open FIRE down on the attacking agents. Agents drop or are driven back out.

Speaker: skylight
Dialogue: BURSTS open and agents rappel down -- FIRING.  Aldo's bodyguard falls, riddled, off the upper level.

Speaker: lower level
Dialogue: as one agent lands, Archer knocks his gun to the floor. They grapple.  As the agent reaches for it -- Adam appears and kicks the gun away.  Just like Mommy.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Buzz...

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Dietrich!  The painting!

Speaker: dietrich
Dialogue: Let's go!

Speaker: sasha
Dialogue: Adam!

Speaker: lower level
Dialogue: An agent aims his shotgun at the glass floor -- at the "target" kneeling on top of it.

Speaker: dietrich
Dialogue: They're like cockroaches!

Speaker: dietrich
Dialogue: If we make it, we'll meet up at my Malibu place.  You remember it, Caz?

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Off Kanan Road -- I know it.

Speaker: sasha
Dialogue: Thank you, Caz... thank you...

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Get the boy out of here...

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: It's too late, Jon.  Your kid loves me.  And your wife's an animal.  Even I can't keep up with her.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Tonight I'm going to make her come like Niagara Falls -- to celebrate your death.

Speaker: pollux
Dialogue: Remember me?  Your 'baby brother'?

Speaker: pollux
Dialogue: You tricked me into telling you things I never told anyone...

Speaker: pollux
Dialogue: Now take it to your grave.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Pollux...

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Peering down into the rotunda.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: OPENS FIRE --

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Get a medic -- now!

Speaker: loomis
Dialogue: Forget him, sir.  It's only Pollux Troy...

Speaker: wanda
Dialogue: What happened?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: What the fuck do you think happened?  Castor Troy just shot him!  What are you waiting for?  Go!

Speaker: kim
Dialogue: Sir -- you're on the cover of Time.  They're calling you 'An Authentic American Hero.'

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: lazarro
Dialogue: We were friends once, Jon, so I feel I owe it to you -- to tell you face-to-face...  I don't care how much hype you're getting -- you're through.  After that massacre last night, I'm ordering a full inquiry into your recent erratic -- and deeply suspect -- behavior.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Me -- 'erratic'?  Victor, what are you talking about?

Speaker: lazarro
Dialogue: You start meeting with Brodie and Miller.  Then they die mysteriously.  Your best friend is murdered -- and you don't seem to give a shit. Suddenly you're smoking, drinking, acting like a man with something to hide...  Maybe you've been bought -- maybe you've lost your mind.  But I promise... I'm going to find out.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Okay, Vic, I have a confession to make.  But you aren't gonna like it...  I'm Castor Troy.

Speaker: lazarro
Dialogue: -- I don't understand...

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Now you understand.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Cancel my four o'clock.  And send for the paramedics. Victor Lazarro's having a heart attack.

Speaker: dispatcher
Dialogue: All units.  I have a confirmed code zero-zero priority alert. Proceed at once to Parthenia Street Terminal.  That's Parthenia at Nordhoff.

Speaker: quick shots
Dialogue: A)  MOTOR POOL  Tac squads pile into armored Jeeps.  B)  HELIPORT  Choppers lift off and veer east.  C)  ARCHER'S HOUSE  The surveillance CARS ROAR away.

Speaker: wanda
Dialogue: Commander, what are you doing here?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Where should I be?  Where's everyone else?

Speaker: wanda
Dialogue: Backing you up!  Didn't you track Castor to the Parthenia Street Terminal?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: wanda
Dialogue: You radioed in your personal security code.  Nobody knows that code but you.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Obviously someone else knows it! Get everybody back to their posts -- now!

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Eve...

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: I'm not going to hurt you.  Just don't scream, okay?  Okay?

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: I know you -- you're the one who called.  You're Castor Troy.  You killed my son --

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: -- I called, but I'm not Castor. I'm your husband.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Now, you're going to listen.  The last time we saw each other -- was in this room.  We had a fight after I told you I had to go away.  My assignment -- Jon Archer's assignment -- was to enter a federal prison as Castor Troy.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: How did he expect to do that?

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: An F.B.I. surgeon gave me Castor's face.  He handled the transplant, the vocal implant, everything. But somehow Castor came out of his coma -- and killed everyone who knew about the mission.  But not before he was transformed into me.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: If you need hard evidence, get it. Your husband's blood type is O negative.  Castor's is A.B.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Remember the parachute dream?  I'm falling, Eve... I'm falling...

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: You're all in knots.  Maybe another date night will help you relax...

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Not tonight... I'm way behind in my Continuing Ed.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: You think I've been acting strange.  Like a completely different person.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: -- Yes.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Okay, I have a confession to make. But you aren't going to like it...

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: And to prove it, I'm taking you and Jamie away on a trip -- right after the memorial service.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: What memorial service?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Victor Lazarro had a heart seizure... right in my office.  It was horrible...

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Oh, my God...

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: First Tito... now Victor...  ... please don't tell me I'm going to lose you, too...

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Of course not.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: What was that?

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: What was what?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Something bit me.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Probably a mosquito -- I'll close the window.

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: Sorry, Dr. Archer.  Where are you going at this hour?

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: There's been an emergency at the hospital.

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: One of us will have to escort you.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Fine...  But please don't wake my husband... he's exhausted.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Please be O-neg.  Please...

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: What are you doing?  Where did you get that gun?

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: I took it from my fake husband.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Why point it at me?  I'm the real thing.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: I don't know that.  Maybe Jon's already dead.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: What more proof do you need?

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Tell me... tell me about the all- night dentist.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: ... I took a date out for chicken and ribs -- not knowing she was a vegetarian.  When the night couldn't get worse, she broke her tooth on a pebble that got into her three-bean salad Somehow she and I had fun driving around looking for an all-night dentist...  And even though it must have hurt -- you still kissed me.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Christ, Jon!  How could you put us in this position?  Do you know -- do you know what he did to me...?

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Whatever happened, whatever he did -- I know it's my fault and I know I can never make it up to you --

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: But you're damn well going to try.  First -- how are we going to get you out of this?

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: This will knock him out for hours.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Good.  What's his schedule tomorrow?

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: He doesn't tell me anymore than you ever did... All I know is -- tomorrow we're going to Victor's memorial service.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Victor... Tito... they both died thinking I killed them... And in a way... I did.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Jon -- you can't think about that now.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: -- What happens after the memorial?

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: He's taking Jamie and me away.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: And neither of you will be coming back.  Where's the service?

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Saint Mary's-By-The-Sea.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: What are you going to do?

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Hit him with a trank dart.  Once he's unconscious -- I'll try to get to Buzz and Wanda before the security team gets to me.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: What else can I do?

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Think up a good excuse.  I don't want you or Jamie anywhere near that service.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: I can cover for Jamie.  But if I'm not there, he'll suspect something...  There's no way around it -- for once, you need me.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: I've always needed you...

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Jon -- what are the odds?

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Terrible.  But it's the best we can do with what we have.  If it doesn't happen, take Jamie and don't look back...

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: It'll happen.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Do doctors travel in packs?

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Only when we're golfing.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Jon!  What are you doing here?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: That's what you're going to explain to me.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Didn't the police tell you?  There was an emergency.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Jon -- stop it!  Mr. Alandro is very ill!

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Not as ill as he's going to be...

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Sorry.  But what's a guy to think when his wife runs off in the middle of the night?

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: It's my fault.  I should've woken you up before I left.  Now please let me get back to work.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Stay here.  Watch her like a hawk.

Speaker: lars
Dialogue: Think she knows?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Who cares?  She's going to be dead by tonight anyway.  They're all going to be dead.  The wife, the kid... and the father.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: How's the boy?

Speaker: sasha
Dialogue: His ears are still ringing -- but he'll be okay.

Speaker: sasha
Dialogue: The truck's all gassed up. Look, Caz, there'll be F.B.I. agents all over that place.  Maybe I can talk my brother into helping us.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: 'Us'?  No, Sasha -- believe me, this isn't your fight.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Thanks...

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Where's Jamie?

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: That's what I'd like to know.  She stole fifty dollars from my purse and took off.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Don't act so stunned, Jon.  You know how hard it is to get that girl into a dress.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: I'll deal with her later.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Good.  Because I am fed up.

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: We are here to celebrate the life of Victor Lazarro.  We all know him as a man who dedicated himself to defending this great nation -- first, as a highly decorated admiral -- then, as west coast director of the F.B.I.  But not all of you know what a deeply spiritual man he was.  It was his wish that his Requiem Mass be performed in Latin.  In Nomine Patris, et Filii et Spiritus Sancti.  Amen...

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: fills the trank-dart with sedative.

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: Domine, de morte aeterna, in die illa tremenda quando caeli movendi sunt et terra...

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: checks her watch... barely lifting her eyes away...  Castor absently pats her knee.  She's forced to return focus to the service.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: chambers the dart, twists a knob on the range-finder, and carefully peers over the crucifix.

Speaker: through scope
Dialogue: Archer TRACKS THROUGH the mourners -- and FINDS Castor. As the cross-hairs neatly cube his head...

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: Requiem aeternam dona eis, Domine... Amen.

Speaker: jamie
Dialogue: Thanks anyway, Mom --  But I wanted to be here for you... and Dad.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: steadies himself, re-aims the sniper rifle.  He hears MOTION behind him.  Someone's coming and fast... but this is his only chance.  Off-balance, Archer squeezes --  THFFFT!  The SILENCED TRANK-DART explodes from the barrel.

Speaker: follow dart
Dialogue: Screaming toward Castor's neck -- but it goes just wide. It sinks harmlessly into the grass -- unnoticed during the 21-GUN SALUTE.

Speaker: on knoll
Dialogue: THUMP!  Archer is cracked across the head.  He slumps down, unconscious, as a silenced gun barrel gently enters his ear.  As the saluting GUNS FIRE in the b.g. -- we don't know when, or if, this pistol fires...

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: The admiral's family will now take his ashes to the sea...

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Lars -- take Jamie, bring the car around, then meet us at that boathouse...

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Wanda -- I need to talk to you.

Speaker: wanda
Dialogue: Sure... what's wrong?

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Never mind --

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Come on, baby.  I've got a surprise for you.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Look who we caught creeping around -- Castor Troy.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Why is he here?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Before I turn him in, I thought we'd pay him back for everything he's put us through...

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Come on, baby.  Join the fun --

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Too bad.  Part of me was hoping you didn't know.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Did you really think it would be that easy, you dumb fucks?  Sorry, baby.  Castor Troy is about to murder you and our daughter... but I promise you won't die unavenged.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: This is between you and me.  Leave them out of this.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: It was between you and me.  Even your little boy -- that wasn't supposed to happen.  But you couldn't let it go.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: No father could.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Appealing to my sense of 'family' won't work, Jon.  I thought you knew me better than that

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: I know some things that even you don't know, Caz.  You have a son. I've met him.  His name is Adam...

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: I imagine I've got a dozen kids -- so what?  No more head games... First your wife dies.  Then your daughter. Then you.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Just one big happy family...

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Dietrich -- Aldo -- Sasha?

Speaker: dietrich
Dialogue: That's right, Archer.  Now drop 'em.

Speaker: lars
Dialogue: Don't fucking move...

Speaker: sasha
Dialogue: Caz -- are you okay?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: You're making a mistake.  I'm Castor -- he's Archer.  Sasha, baby -- just give me a minute to explain!

Speaker: sasha
Dialogue: That's pathetic, Archer.  But then, your terrible sense of humor is legendary.

Speaker: aldo
Dialogue: It's pay-back time.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Find Jamie!

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Jamie?  Jamie!

Speaker: sasha
Dialogue: ... Help Adam... don't let him end up like us...

Speaker: dietrich
Dialogue: Sasha -- !

Speaker: wanda
Dialogue: We heard gunshots --

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Wanda, I've got to tell you something.  Something crazy...

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Give up, Castor.  People are going to find out.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Not if I kill you first.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Give it here, Jamie.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: No, Jamie.  Don't do it!

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Listen to my voice, Jamie.  I'm your father.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: It's a trick, Jamie.  I'm your father.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Shoot him, Jamie.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Jamie...

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Shoot him!

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: You dunce.  No kid of mine would miss so badly.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Just saving the taxpayers the cost of a trial.  So take a hike.

Speaker: wanda
Dialogue: You're both under arrest until a D.N.A. test proves who's who.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: I'm ordering you to back off!

Speaker: wanda
Dialogue: Put the gun down --

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: -- Now!

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Can't blame me for trying.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Say goodbye to Daddy --

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: Give me your weapon -- now!

Speaker: jamie
Dialogue: Who are you?  Will someone please tell me what's going on?

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: limps away from the boatyard, towards the slips -- alive with sunbathers and yachters.

Speaker: boat captain
Dialogue: Hey -- !

Speaker: castor's pov
Dialogue: Archer running down the dock toward the adjoining boat.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: FIRES -- peppering the dock.  Archer knocks the boat owner to safety -- as the BAIT HOUSE BLOWS UP behind him.  Archer rolls into the boat -- FIRING.  Castor's hit!  A slug grazes his shoulder.  He grabs the THROTTLE -- taking off.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: FIRES UP the second BOAT -- in pursuit.  Castor BLASTS back -- SHATTERING Archer's BOAT COMPASS.

Speaker: civilian boat
Dialogue: speeds toward him -- causing a near-miss.

Speaker: another angle
Dialogue: Running parallel, Archer and Castor BLAST at EACH OTHER at point-blank range.  Their boats smash and pound each other.  A police boat closes in on them.  Castor FIRES at the police -- obliterating both crew and boat.  The POLICE BOAT'S rear SMASHES into Archer's craft.  Archer's BOAT plows up and through the other.  EXPLOSION! Momentum carries Archer across -- and back into the water.  The boat lands right next to Castor's.  Archer and Castor resume their battering... approaching a --

Speaker: tug
Dialogue: pulling a barge.  Castor forces Archer into its path.  At the last moment...  Archer leaps onto the bow of Castor's boat as --  KA-BOOM!  Archer's boat crashes into the BARGE which EXPLODES.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: swerves wildly -- trying to throw Archer off.  Archer can only watch as Castor reaches for another clip.  But the boat hits a wave...  Castor loses the gun -- which skids away.  Archer slips, his head hanging over the side.  Castor tries to ram Archer, but he pulls himself up just in time.  Castor grabs the anchor -- swings it.  WHUNK!  It sinks into the deck beside Archer -- but the chain is around his neck.  As Castor tries to strangle him -- Archer headbutts Castor, who reels -- snagging his leg around the chain. Castor falls back -- plunging toward the water.  Archer tries to hold Castor up... as the boat speeds toward --

Speaker: pier
Dialogue: Archer yanks Castor back onto the deck as the BOAT BOUNCES OFF the pier pilings.  But as they slug it out...

Speaker: another angle
Dialogue: WHAM!  The BOAT careens off a piling -- and ROARS straight for the shipyard.  COLLIDING with a shoreline obstruction --  The BOAT FLIPS, stern over bow...  Archer and Castor go flying... onto the beach.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: You won't shoot me, Jon.  I'm unarmed...

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: Okay, I have a confession to make... but you aren't gonna like it... You're right, I won't shoot you.  Not in the face anyway.

Speaker: castor
Dialogue: It'll never be over, Jon... every time you look in the mirror... you'll see my face...

Speaker: buzz
Dialogue: You okay, Archer?

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: What did you call me?

Speaker: wanda
Dialogue: He called you 'Archer' -- sir.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Hang on, Jon... they're bringing in their top surgical team from D.C...

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: How is he?

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: No life signs at all.  He's a turnip.

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: That's what they always say...

Speaker: wanda
Dialogue: I'm sorry, Eve.  You can't come.  Take her home.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: But he's my husband!

Speaker: wanda
Dialogue: But he works for us.

Speaker: jamie
Dialogue: Will Dad be Dad again?

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: I hope so, honey.

Speaker: jamie
Dialogue: And you guys say my life is screwed up...

Speaker: jamie
Dialogue: I'm sorry I shot you, Dad.  Am I grounded?

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: I have something to ask you -- to ask both of you...

Speaker: archer
Dialogue: This is Adam.  He needs a place to live... just for a little while.

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: How was your first day back?

Speaker: eve
Dialogue: Jon?
